titleStmt.title: How sick -- to wait -- in any place -- but thine --

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Johnson, 1955

lg.l: How sick -- to wait -- in any place -- but thine --
I knew last night -- when someone tried to twine --
Thinking perhaps -- that I looked tired -- or alone --
Or breaking -- almost -- with unspoken pain --
One port -- suffices -- for a Brig -- like mine --
Our's be the tossing -- wild though the sea --
Rather than a Mooring -- unshared by thee.
Our's be the Cargo -- unladen -- here --
